review_title: Past glory doesn't help in the cloud age anymore
pros:
If you are dealing with Fujitsu Japan, it can be culturally interesting.
Fujitsu is still highly regarded in Japan. Still a great place if you are into certain hardware development aspects.
cons: Japanese managers have a faint idea about how to do business outside of Japan. They also exhibit exceedingly hierarchical and political thinking. Usually marginal English skills don't help with staff communication - and there's very little of it in the first place. The regional subsidiaries all struggle with the move to the cloud and the shift from old school data centers to hyperscalers - with basically no differentiators. If you are into software development - do yourself a favour and keep your distance.

pros: Many experienced seniors to learn from. There are also lots of budgets for projects which means that engineers can really work on big projects.
cons: There are very few young engineers in my team. When I say few, I mean only 4 out of around 30 engineers! This means that it is very hard to push through with your ideas because of course, seniors would have a stronger say into whatever gets decided.

job_title: Service Delivery Manager in Łódź, Lódz
pros: Benefits and Senior management (Not Local GDC management)
cons:
The worst experience I ever had in my career, foreigners are not welcomed to get higher even though their performance is the best. This is not the fault of the company by the management who seem not willing to deliver good service for their customers, reading in forums and listening webinars everyone speaking about diversity and inclusion, customer centric but in reality there is total discrimination and never keep customer fully satisfied which is silly strategy. 

I am a foreigner and I got fired without any notice even though I have timeless contract, I received the termination letter via email and I was simply shocked they claimed that I have performance issue while in my 4 years in FJ I was the top performer , when I mentioned this is unfair and there is a mistake somewhere, they asked me to go to court as I dont have the right to complaint. The maturity of HR is questionable as terminating contract of employee in this way is unprofessional.

In addition to all this, the salary is lower over 35% comparing to other companies in the same city - Lodz/Poland-, the salary of Service Desk Agent (1st line) in other companies is almost equal to salary of Team Manager in Fujitsu.

job_title: Service Desk Agent in Łódź, Lódz
pros: Colleagues are great. It's the way you gain knowledge. Management only offer useless power point slides.
cons:
Everything. They are not telling you that you are actually supporting Great Britain market as main market, and not your native language market for what you were hired. You will get ticket from this market for the same money (4500 zlt, language bonus included 1000 zlt). You learn nothing useful. None of the knowledge you aquire can transferred to your next job. 
Polish people are protected by their nationals. Discrimination is in your face. If you are a foreign worker, when they will no longer needing you, they will fire you without any explanation or reason. Very bad management practices. Managers are poorly trained, many of them don't even have college degrees, being promoted for just being polish nationals. 
They don't care about your knowledge, how prepared you are, how good you are: just answer the phone. This is what they tell you. They are focused only on getting their contract with the client (in my case H&M) going.
Poor salaries, low level knowledge, abusive managers, lies. Only if you are desperate. Most agents have a second job to be able to sustain a decent life quality.

pros: Fujitsu have done an excellent job of caring for their employees during Fujitsu during Covid-19. The vast majority of people at Fujitsu are absolutely lovely and this is one of the main reasons I like working for them. You can achieve a good work life balance, and the pay is usually fair. The culture is excellent and Fujitsu truly believe in making the tech industry more sustainable and more accessible for less advantaged groups.
cons: General approach is a little less forward-thinking or "edgy" than other competitors in the tech space such as Apple, HP etc. But this is balanced out by their solid and reliable nature. There is a tendency for it to feel like the majority of employees to be old white men, but this is definitely changing.

review_title: A place where racism and discrimination has a name written in bold
job_title: Service Delivery Manager in Łódź, Lódz
pros: The only good thing in Fujitsu is senior management in Japan,
cons:
during my career working in many companies I never been humiliated but Fujitsu did. Having a company like fujitsu firibg those people who are giving the best to customers is absolutely insane. Many customers left fujitsu Poland and went to HCL, Infosys and other companies where maturity is better. In Fujitsu Poland this is how it works:

1- You get promoted if you have contacts with managers.
2- You work hard you stuck in your position until they promotd their friends then they give you rubbish position.
3- Due to corruption in giving position, this impacts on quality of work, imagine 5 people were promoted unlawfully and 1 bcz of his her performance, all thr workload goes to the one who is hard working, this employee will cover on their mistakes.
4- Those hard working people are being transferred too often to critical customers to clean the mess of the bad people. Once everything is stable, the credit goes to others and never recognise the work.

5- Dismissal of employees being done in illegal way, they never give reasons why they are ending contracts, if angone asks why their answer "go to the court"
6- HR falsifying reports, every timr someone leaves the company HR asks him her about reasons, employees are leaving due to management and bad work environment later in the report they ask the employee to sign where it is written different reasons.
7- Many foreigners need the work permit to work, they refuse to give work permit. They fired many foreigners for no reasons.

8- Data leak, it happened so many times that secrets of customers were stolen and sold elsewhere, if customer is victim why no punishment was taken for those people?

9- Many security breaches in their devices, people used to watch footbal match in the office. MANY WEBSITES are not blocked, you can watch, access any website you want, including DarkWeb websites.
10- There is no placd for foreigners to work, every foreigner works with fears to get dismissed at any time.
11- Diversity and Inclusion has only a title but in reality is absent.

pros: A way of getting your foot in the door to work for a proper IT desk. We'll, it's suppose to be good for that
cons:
Awful marking system that doesn't make moral or practical sense. You cannot use the toilet more than 30 minutes per month. Everyone can see your agent score, how often you've been using the toilet and you're constantly pressured to meet at least 95 percent on a scoring system that doesn't reflect at all on how professional you are or how we'll you are serving your customer. It's all based on how fast you can get the call finished and how many insidents you manage to close. (closing certainly does not mean solve) usually means you've managed to fob the user off. Progression isn't necessarily given to someone that will be a positive impact to the company. You'll notice that the ones progressing tend to go to the pub with each other and management tend to pick who they think will be a laugh to join their team. Once you aren't an agent you're in the position where you can pass pass responsibility on others and just smoke cigarettes and fart and pretend to look at emails from time to time. Agents are told to buddy up with other agents who are usually very stressed out and do t really need anyone listening to what they're doing and asking questions because they're stressed enough trying to do the job themselves with poor training. The building and everything in it doesn't get cleaned well and looks like it's never been cleaned at all. Agents have brought this to management so many times and usually get a sarcastic response and everyone is told to clean their desk themselves. Management are allowed to isolate every other week and come into office the other but if you're an agent you have to come in every day. The environment in the building I'm working at isnt prepared and made safe for workers during a pandemic. Equipment is broken or of very poor quality and is usually very disgusting. Most of the time there's someone that isn't even able to sit at a seat because the companys hired too many people and doesn't have enough seats or equipment for them. Agents suffer a lot of abuse from customers each day due to people higher up the chain not caring and forgetting to give crucial information and have awful guidance on how to manage situations. You're expected to refer to a knowledge base for any questions the customer might have or to help solve their issue. The information is quite often wrong though or ot updated and when the customer asks why you are left stressed and cannot tell the truth otherwise you could lose your job.

This is my honest experience of the floor I work on and the rest of the building seems a lot nicer and workers are respected more as human being should be.

More money needs to be spend and corners need to stop being cut. There needs to be an over all positive and can do attitude and not just reacting to things going wrong at the last second. The energy in the building is very draining and negative and there needs to be more effort in showing the benefit of working as a team and showing respect to each other. 

The pay is really bad considering what the job intels.

7. Place for old-workers who already spent 15+ years in same company - layoffs very common, recently shut down SantaClara office, and sent 2/3 of employees to india. 
8. Lot of Politics - you will end up learning nothing. 
9. Regret accepting offer from here and rejecting offers from other companies.
10. You will be racially profiled if not chinese. You will find a lot of indian and chinese folk. Many employees will be outsourced in India.
11. Technology and Products they work on is outdated. You will wonder where they even generate their revenue. No legit customers. Company running on loss. 

If you recently joined here, please pack your bags and leave when you can.

review_title: Seems like a great company to work for so far, great atmosphere and great opportunities
pros: Having worked here for only 6 or 7 months, I've been working remotely (Covid) and have not actually met my colleagues in person yet. However I have still been accepted into the team and feel part of them. My opinions are valued and my voice is heard within my Project team. This also seems to be the case outside of the team though I haven't had much experience with this as of yet. My manager is very good at recommending training and opportunities. He is very good at breaking down the information disseminated from the higher ups which is good considering that it is a very large company. They are very flexible in working hours however it seems as though they will not be continuing significant WFH arrangements after covid. They on the whole do seem to value their workforce and want to look after it which is more than can be said for most SIs. There is a lot of talk around diversity and inclusion in the company which is great.
cons: While my manager is good at recommending training, I rarely seem to get any time to do it! The job is fast paced and there is little room for rest, let alone doing some training in the day. Their IT infrastructure is not the most up to date, many seem to be being given older laptops when the join, though I think I was a lucky one and got a new laptop. They could implement better in-company communication systems as Skype really does suck at the moment. (Why skype can't just keep a conversation string going day-to-day is beyond me!)

job_title: Service Desk Agent in Lisbon, Lisbon District
pros:
Extra benefits: 
Health insurance, meals card, language bonus.

Facilities:
Lisbon facilities are excellent, providing an inviting office environment.

Covid19 approach: 
All employees were able to keep their jobs - remote-working from home has been deployed.
cons:
General impression:
Dysfunctional and disorganized, leading to impracticable expectations. 

Training:
Poor training program, which only addresses introductory material but does not teach how to perform daily operations. Most of the training consists in watching a colleague without understanding what is happening. 

Systems & Tools:
Constantly failing. Circumstances do not reflect projected image, nor desired service quality standards. 

Employee evaluation:
Employee performance statistics are affected by issues beyond their control (lack of proper training and malfunctioning tools).

Leadership and Structure:
Too many procedures in relation to daily operations are unknown, unclear or lacking. Internal communication between collaborating inter-dependent teams is slow and often difficult (counterproductive).
Very cordial and respectful Managers, contrasting with authoritarian and unreasonable Team Leaders.

My role responsibilities changed 3 times within 1 1/2 fiscal years at FCPA. Quotas are set 2 months into fiscal year and are generic and unattainable. In a declining hardware division leadership chose to increase quotas by 10%. I was focused on lowering revenue churn from 11% to 6% in 2019. But when given my 2020 quota I knew leadership does not comprehend basic sales.

job_title: Technical Architecture Manager in Crewe, England
pros: They respect their employees, are fair and excellent to work for.
cons: Salaries aren't as high as other organisations

pros:
Good interesting work to be done, when assigned/ allowed. 
Minimal supervision of work, trusted to get on with it.
cons:
Psychotic bad tempered managers - this is no exaggeration.  I was screamed at more than once for minor transgressions, such as being 5 mins late, while others  in the team got away with  much more.  This is blatant victimisation.

Also experienced direct side-lining.   Forced to do nothing for months while team I was supposed to be a part of were extremely busy.

Cronyism rife - frequently saw other less experienced colleagues promoted to more senior tech. positions/ management, because they were in favour. 

Over reliance on contractors, to the detriment of permanent staff.  Contractors were frequently hired to do work that others, with little to do could do with ease/ minimal handover or training.  This appeared to be cronyism again.

Lack of promotional/ developmental  opportunities for those not part of the in-crowd. 


Wage rises small and infrequent.  

Staff performance appraisals seem to be paper ticking exercises.  Management did not use these to seriously develop/ progress staff, in my experience.  The get-out clause for them seems to be "your development is your responsibility".   However if blocked from training or promotion to more interesting teams, while seeing colleagues routinely moved between teams to fill new positions, or promoted to new positions, which were never advertised, this feels extremely unfair.

pros: There's potential there, but it constantly falls flat.
cons:
Work and promotions are given by favour, not by ability, skill, or past experiences. If you're loud, pushy, and steal others' work, you'll be noticed. If you're a white guy, you'll always be given a seat at the table (even if others "outrank" them). You'll be welcomed by superiors to join their ranks regardless of your actual output. If you're a woman or a person of color, you'll have to work twice as hard to get noticed half as much. There are managers there that will openly tell you they care about their personal reputation first, far past their own team. I have heard managers (that were being recorded) yell and scream to get their way when what they wanted was going to hurt their customers (and did!). If you try to put the customer first, they will silence you, dismiss you, and talk over you to get their way. 

They encourage this behavior by continually rewarding these blokes and giving them more responsibility. Sales is set up against each other so departments are fighting over the same work without the customer's best interest in mind. The work silos prevent new work from ever coming in and wastes so much effort. A lot of talent working there now is just waiting to be offered the right opportunity to leave but COVID messed everything up. Still looking.

job_title: Senior Consultant in Perth, Western Australia
pros:
Company have good contacts and clients around town.
Large company, can give large clients confidence.
Some really strong senior staff from which to learn.
A good place to build a network of contacts and references.
Very Strong Service Delivery capability.
World Class Data Centres.
cons:
Managed by spreadsheet, very short term thinking.  
Lots of bluff and posturing.  Management propogate false sense of strengths, merits, capability and positioning to staff and clients even though they know they lack the true depth and capability.  This is more of the rule than an exception.
Always late to the party with market trends, such as missing most of Oil & Gas growth opportunity in the WA market, similarly the rush to punt Cloud services, but not having house in order in terms of delivery or billing.  Similarly late to the party with Mobile and Big Data offerings.
Poor growth ambitions, and poor execution strategy, all year by year by year, no discernable long term plan, other than loose ambitions, such as be number 3 player, or offer mobility solutions.
Most growth achieved by acquisition.  No discernable investment in bolstering capability other than  national restructure.
Seemingly oblivious to poor morale, many examples of employees delivering above their pay rate, but not rewarded or recognised accordingly.
No real staff career development or training, in-house brown-bag sessions offered in lieu of proper investment or training.
Forced leave during December.
